text: Elder Island is an irregularly shaped island located at the eastern opening of the Fury and Hecla Strait. Situated in Nunavut's Qikiqtaaluk Region within the northern Canadian Arctic, the island is north of the Melville Peninsula and Ormonde Island. It is approximately south of Baffin Island (separated by Adolf Jensen Sound), while the Foxe Basin is to the east. == External links == * Elder Island in the Atlas of Canada - Toporama; Natural Resources Canada Category:Islands of the Canadian Arctic Archipelago Category:Uninhabited islands of Qikiqtaaluk Region
title: Elder Island
